dfischer.utils

Class DataCollectionErrorEventItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.DataCollectionAbstractItem
      • dfischer.utils.DataCollectionErrorEventItem

  • public class DataCollectionErrorEventItem
extends DataCollectionAbstractItem
    A data collection item which is a measured error and contains at least a time stamp. Optionally, the item can contain also an error title and an error text.
    Note: Special chars for formatting the error text are <BOLD></BOLD> and <COLOR=#999999></COLOR>
    Since:
    V5.5-C
    See Also:
    DataCollectionAbstractItem.ITEM_TYPE_ERROR_EVENT, DataCollectionSequence

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataCollectionErrorEventItem

        public DataCollectionErrorEventItem(long timeStamp)
        Normal constructor. Creates an error event and initialize it with a time stamp and an unique error ID. Note that you need to set additionally/optionally the error title and an error text.
        Parameters:
        timeStamp - the time stamp (elapsed milliseconds, between the measured point of time and midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC).
        See Also:
        setErrorTitle(String), appendErrorTextLine(String)

      • DataCollectionErrorEventItem

        public DataCollectionErrorEventItem()
        Object transfer constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • setErrorTitle

        public void setErrorTitle(java.lang.String errorTitle)
        Set the error title.
        Parameters:
        errorTitle - the error title

      • getErrorTitle

        public java.lang.String getErrorTitle()
        Get the error title.
        Returns:
        the error title, or null if no such information is available

      • appendErrorTextLine

        public void appendErrorTextLine(java.lang.String errorTextLine)
        Append a line to the error text. This method can be called multiple times. Note: Special chars for formatting the error text are <BOLD></BOLD> and <COLOR=#999999></COLOR>
        Parameters:
        errorTextLine - a line of the error text.

      • assignErrorNumber

        public void assignErrorNumber(long errorNumber)
        For internal use only. Assign an error number which is consecutively numbered related to the data collection sequence to which the item is added.
        Parameters:
        errorNumber - the error number to assign
        Since:
        V5.5-D

      • getErrorNumber

        public long getErrorNumber()
        Get the error number.
        Returns:
        the error number
        Since:
        V5.5-D

        Get the error text.
        Returns:
        the error text, or null if no such information is available
